conclusion: Analyzing the light ray's path through the semi-cylindrical object.
Semi-cylindrical transparent object with radius R; light enters along axis OA from the left; light enters at point C at distance sqrt(3)/3 R from O; no light exits from the right side.
Need to find the refractive index of the object.
Total internal reflection is occurring because light doesn't exit the right side.
Ray enters at point C, travels through the object, hits the curved surface at point P, and undergoes total internal reflection.
At point C, the ray enters perpendicularly to the flat surface, so there's no refraction (angle of incidence is 0°).
Determine the angle of incidence at point P using geometry.
For total internal reflection, the angle of incidence at P must equal the critical angle θc.
Using geometry, establish the angle of incidence i = |θ - α|.
At the critical angle: sin(θc) = 1/n₂; angle of incidence must equal the critical angle.
Ray CP makes an angle α = arctan(sqrt(3)/3) = 30° with the horizontal; angle of incidence i = 60°.
Calculate refractive index using critical angle formula: sin(60°) = 1/n₂; n₂ = 2/sqrt(3) = 2sqrt(3)/3 ≈ 1.155.
The refractive index of the transparent object for this monochromatic light is 2sqrt(3)/3.
